resources.string:
Snakelike body

 Undershot mouth.

 Dorsal (back) and anal fins are fused with the tail fin forming a single ribbon running along much of the body.

The body shows a number of dark vertical bands

 Two back fins that are clearly separate.

 A black spot can be seen in the back end of the frontal back fin.

A high backed body, flattened at the sides.

 The diameter of the eye is smaller than the distance between eye and mouth.

 Slightly undershot mouth that can be extended

Mouth positioned straight at end

 The eye has a red spot in the upper half

 Front of the back fin and bellyfin are positioned in line.

2-4 spines are positioned in front of the back fin.

 Back and anal fin are postioned at the back of the body.

 Males in the breeding season have a red throat and belly and blue eyes.

Big, broad head with swollen cheeks and lips. Undershot mouth.

 Belly fins have merged into a sucker.

 Red and brown marble pattern on body and head.

6 short barbels at the mouth, 4 on the upper lip and 2 in the corners of the mouth.

 The sides show a line of dark brown spots

 there is a forked spike below the eye that is oriented towards the tail.

One barbel on the chin

 2 back fins that are clearly separate

 Belly fins are located in front of the breast fins

The eyes are positioned high in the head

 The nostrils are short tubes

 Two separate back fins, of which the hindmost one is fused with the tail fin

The eyes are positioned high in the head

 The hindmost back fin and the anal fin slope to the back

 The fish had a pale colour, light blue gray at the sides with fuzzy dark spots

The smallest perch like fish, up to 14cm

 The body, tail and back fin has tiny dark spots

 Bottom dweller with a preference for deeper water

The two back fins touch, the hindmost being longer that the front one

 The operculum (gill) has upright spikes

 No scales on the thead

Undershot mouth

 The front of the back fin is positioned clearly behind the front of the belly fins

 Bright red fins

Anal fin and back fin are positioned near the back of the body

 The head sports a flat and broad mouth

 The body has golden dots or stripes

The two back fins are separate

 The upper jaw extends to behind the eye

 The operculum (gill) is pointy

In front of the back fin are 9 to 11 spikes

 The belly fin is silver

 Anal fin and back fin are positioned near the back of the body

The iris of the eye is orange

 The fins are round in shape

 The mouth has a small barbel at each corner

The operculum (gill) often has an dark orange spot, surrounded with a black rim

 The back fin has a front part with tough spikes and a higher back part

 The body has a prominent pattern with blueish sides and yellowbrown and red spots

The front back fin has a black spot in the back

 The belly fins are grown together into a sucker

 The hindmost back fin is straight
